Articles.Content:
Since bobcat has decided to get rid of the .craft files of the MIR space station I have decided to recreate them without the MIR ASAS as well as possible recreate the ISS community station without the MIR ASAS as well.

So I Understand this does not solve the issue of downloading the Historical Pack or the ISS pack and hitting the craft files right out of there, but if you download this pack (soon to be released) you will have each module with a launcher (again historical as I know) so you can build them

I hope you enjoy.

FINALLY

Link removed

Thanks to ... not headhunter67

And stay tuned to my YouTube channel for more updates.

Link removed

Edited September 28, 2013 by Cykyrios
removed links

Did you forget to... you know, include the files? This section is for completed add-ons. As it currently stands, this isn't a thread for Add-Ons, it's an advertisement for your channel. I'm sure that wasn't your intent and you'll edit your post to include a link.
well I as we speak trying to get the balance right on each module, but thank you so much for pointing out there is not a link, but I am planning to put it on spaceport to ease you mind.
But if you want explain to me why I cannot upload multiple .craft files to space port. I mean since you have nearly 800 posts since July you must know so much you surely would know my issue.

It's not for my peace of mind - it's to keep the mods from moving (or worse, locking) your thread. Current status would be "unreleased", so you can see why they would move it out of "releases".

That said, I do look forward to when you have completed your work. I built MIR from the Soviet Pack but had to include the ASAS from an older version - with all the troubles that caused. It will be nice if people don't need to go through that hassle and can build MIR without an obsolete part. Hopefully, BobCat will give us updated files in the next version.

As for why you cannot upload multiple craft files to SpacePort? I'd ask "why are you trying to upload them separately?" Put them all in one .zip since people are going to want to use all six modules to build the station. If that doesn't work, I can only wish you luck.

Edited September 28, 2013 by HeadHunter67

The mod has been released. It is not mine, which I already said. I put it in here so people can find it since many download bobcats mods and have no .craft files to go off of. But you sir, are just trying to be a douche. But so are many people that troll forums.

But what should we expect from an obvious forum troll.

You have nearly 800 posts in (if I give you the benefit of joining on July 1 which is 90 days ) 9 posts per day.

Edited September 28, 2013 by FlyingRoss

I'm in full agreement with HeadHunter67 on this one. He is most certainly not a troll - a troll isn't someone who disagrees with you.

The Add-on Releases section is for custom parts or plugins you have authored yourself, and maybe the occassional "welded" part or reconfigured stock part. It is not for sharing craft files.

And yes, this definitely smells like an advert for a channel.

Edited September 28, 2013 by sumghai

OK, I'll break it down so it's clearer to you:

You created a thread in Mod Releases for craft files - files that you still did not include a link to in this thread. So you've released nothing. In fact, the only link I see is for your channel.

It's clear to me that this was your primary intent - to advertise your YouTube channel. This isn't the section for that. I tried to give you some good advice, and a heads-up on the expectations the moderators have for this section. I even tried to pay you a compliment. But you're looking to start something - I'm not here to argue with you.

Yes, I have an average of about 10 posts a day. Many of them are trying to help people with issues just like yours - but usually, they have the good grace to be grateful about it.

Whereas, of your 13 posts, 4 of them have been in a thread which should, by rights, be locked until you have something to actually contribute.

Maybe you need more than well-intentioned advice from a fellow member. I'll remind someone who can actually solve this problem.

You seem to be very confused here, Headhunter isn't a forum troll nor does he want to become one.

This place is for Add-On Releases and Projects. Basically, add-ons and other things that have already been completed and are meant to be released to the public should go here. They should include download links, pictures and a description about the mod/project/tool, and have a liscence. From what I can tell is that you are uploading .craft files of the MIR space station. Since this is more of a craft fie and not a mod or addon, or even a tool, it should by right belong into the Spacecraft Exchange.

And the part about spaceport, let me clarify that.

Headhunter appreciates your work and would like to see you upload the files to space port, but he is saying if you put all the six craft files into a zip file, it will be much easier to upload and much easier for others to download. Is it not hard to understand that he is actually trying to give you advice?

Anyway I hope this clears up and it would be nice to see the MIR on spaceport.

EDIT: ninja'ed by Headhunter himself. And sumghai.

Edited September 28, 2013 by T-Pilot395

I love the fact you have been in this community for a whole 3 months and are claiming threads "by rights" should be locked.

Get off your high horse kid. I posted thinking it would be easy to get to spaceport, and I was wrong.

SOOOO SORRY I DID NOT MEET YOUR STANDARDS

I have been playing this game since August 2012, yep sorry do not feel the need to post ever day, like some spotlight whores

And I find it hilarious that you claim to be helping people but you have no idea how to upload to spaceport.

Well, this thread seems pleasant!

OP, you'll want to be heading over here. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/20-The-Spacecraft-Exchange
and still everything is in a zip folder and says error .....

you have no idea how to upload to spaceport.

To be fair - neither do you.

I have no need to know how. I don't mod for KSP. We have one thing in common, at least.

I don't understand why you are so angry with me - what, exactly, have I done that you feel a need to insult me and call me names?

Edited September 28, 2013 by HeadHunter67

If you really can't upload to spaceport, another file hosting site like Mediafire will do too.

And you might want to make a request to move this thread to the Spacecraft Exchange thread. Since this is about craft files and the whatnot.

and still everything is in a zip folder and says error .....

I myself maintain one mod on Spaceport, often uploading updates. You should ask for help in the dedicated Spaceport subforums.

Better yet, upload your craft files to a Dropbox account, and link to the zip files from there in the Spacecraft Exchange.

EDIT - lel, now it's my turn to be ninja'd by T-Pilot395

My my, this thread got hot with a misunderstanding.

FYI, I've been here since April 2012, I simply didn't create a forum account for a long time.

Figured it out.

Amazing how you are offering the "Community" so much "help" yet could not actually give any.

But its up with the first 3 craft files. If this thread is in the wrong thread so be it the mods can decide that; not you headhunter.

I was not developing my own unique .craft files but simply trying to fill the void where bobcat deleted his because of the MIR ASAS.

but thanks for being a huge hemorrhoid.

Well you know, it's easy enough to understand the rules, spacecraft exchange for .Craft files, addon RELEASES for addons made by that pereson or updated, yours wasn't a "released" mod at the time of posting, so it did not belong here, just saying.

Amazing how you are offering the "Community" so much "help" yet could not actually give any.

The last time I checked, HeadHunter67 had 24 reputation points awarded to him by people who appreciated his help with / insights into various matters.

If this thread is in the wrong thread so be it the mods can decide that; not you headhunter.

While mods do indeed have the final say over where threads should be moved, HeadHunter is merely stating an observation from countless other folks who were less fortunate to have their threads moved/deleted.

I was not developing my own unique .craft files but simply trying to fill the void where bobcat deleted his because of the MIR ASAS.

Actually, that's pretty...bad.

Not long ago a member of the community repackaged the KerbTown and Kerbin City add-ons together into one download, believing he was doing everyone a service. Unfortunately, the moderators deleted it because he was technically redistributing whole mods without the rightful creator's permission. What you're doing is quite similar - even more so now that you've admitted your work isn't original.
Sumghai has a point- have you asked Bobcat for permission on redestributing his mod?

All in all I guess it's up to the moderators to settle this.

And if you are going to continue uploading this please send a request to Bobcat Industries for permission to redistribute the craft files.

EDIT: Dammit Destroyer, second time I've been ninja'ed.

The last time I checked, HeadHunter67 had 24 reputation points awarded to him by people who appreciated his help with / insights into various matters.

While mods do indeed have the final say over where threads should be moved, HeadHunter is merely stating an observation from countless other folks who were less fortunate to have their threads moved/deleted.

Actually, that's pretty...bad.

Not long ago a member of the community repackaged the KerbTown and Kerbin City add-ons together into one download, believing he was doing everyone a service. Unfortunately, the moderators deleted it because he was technically redistributing whole mods without the rightful creator's permission. What you're doing is quite similar - even more so now that you've admitted your work isn't original.

Yea but see.... I am not repackaging entire mods. But nice try.

But still love your mod. As I use it for my refueling station.

Amazing how you are offering the "Community" so much "help" yet could not actually give any.

If this thread is in the wrong thread so be it the mods can decide that; not you headhunter.

As I said, the advice I was offering was not for my sake - it's up to you how you choose to deal with a reminder.

I'm sorry I can't help you with your remaining problem - but I'm sure someone will be along eventually who will.

As for the files, are these the same files that you were begging for in the BobCat thread last night and that Tonupboy sent you a link to?

Thanks so much for your hard work. I hope when you copied the files you were sent, you remembered to realign the solar panel on the MIR Core so that it extends properly...

Well you are redistributing part of the mods.

While the person who packaged KerbTown and Kerbin City can be related to someone taking your two cars and smashing them together without your permission, you're taking the car tires and smashing those together without permission instead.

It's kinda the same thing.

And uh, even so, it won't hurt to ask for permission.
sad thing is I have not re-distributing his mod. Anyone trying this would have to download his mod.
